column2: Hi there how are you doing today?
column3: Hey I ' m find.
column4: How are you doing?
column5: I am doing really good.
column6: So, what are you up to today?
column7: I've been thinking about donating to a children's charity.
column8: I can't decide which onne.
column9: I was going to ask you if you would be interested in donating to Save the Children.
column10: How do you feel about this charity?
column11: I have heard about it but I can't remember it's mission.
column12: Do you know that charity's mission?
column13: They provide kids with the basic things they need like food and clothing.
column14: I really like their mission.
column15: I really feel badly for the kids.
column16: Don't you?
column17: Yes, it tugs at my heart to think of all of those children.
column18: Do you know where the charity is headquatered?
column19: They are based in CT.
column20: I feel that it would be easy to donate.
column21: I know I spend on little things like a candy bar or gum.
column22: I know I could give up spending on this and it would help the kids.
column23: Could you donate anything to them?
column24: yes I can.
column25: I can donate 10 dollars.
column26: Wow!
column27: that is so great.
column28: Thank you so much.
column29: Are you hoping that the money goes to a certain cause like food or clothes?
column30: OH, yeah food please.
column31: Gotta feed the hungry first
column32: Yes!
column33: I think that is a great idea.
column34: I am glad you decided to be part of this really great cause.
column35: Have you ever donated to a charity before this?
column36: no this is my first time.
column37: what do I do now?
column38: You do not have to do anything else.
column39: I am really glad that you donated.
column40: What are your other plans for the day today?
column41: WOW, I was just going to ask you the same thing.
column42: I plan on doing some more surveys, then taking a drive up on the parkway and have a picnic.
column43: Yes, I also plan on having a day of fun too.
column44: I am hoping to find some photo albums and get those worked on.
column45: Do you still get printed pictures or do you do all digital pictures?
column46: Printed pictures all the way for me, it's what I know.
column47: What kind of camera do you have?
column48: I have a really old digital camera.
column49: I also have a smartphone, but I am thinking about getting a newer one.
column50: I have heard the cameras on the new smartphones are good.
column51: Do you have a smartphone that takes good pictures?
column52: Yeah, I have one, but I don't use the camera.
column53: I have an old Nikon 360 camera that takes film.
column54: Do you have anything like that?

column5: Would you like to hear about ways you can help Save the Children today!
column6: Sure.
column7: Tell me as much as you can about the organization.
column8: Save the Children is an international non-governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries.
column9: It sounds like they have a worthy cause.
column10: Do they help our children in the US as well?
column11: This is a charity for children that are victims of war and hard times.
column12: For children in developing countries, especially in war zones.
column13: For instance, millions of Syrian children have grown up facing the daily threat of violence.
column14: In the first two months of 2018 alone, 1,000 children were reportedly killed or injured in intensifying violence.
column15: Wow, it is great that these children have a charity to help them.
column16: Very much so!
column17: Would you like to be apart of this great charity and donate today?
column18: I would like to donate.
column19: How do I donate?
column20: How much do you like to donate to the charity now?
column21: Your donation will be directly deducted from your task payment.

column8: Are they a non profit organization?

column10: They work 100% on donated funds.
column11: There is  a lack of support for children in developing countries, especially in war zones.
column12: For instance, millions of Syrian children have grown up facing the daily threat of violence.
column13: In the first two months of 2018 alone, 1,000 children were reportedly killed or injured in intensifying violence.
column14: Your donation can address such problems.
column15: Oh wow, shocking news.
column16: Do you know how many children have been helped due to this organization?
column17: According t0 their yearend report they were able to reach 155 million children.
column18: Over 200k of those kids were in the US.
column19: Thats awesome!
column20: Are you apart of this organization or just support them?
column21: I am just a supporter but I would like to ask how much do you like to donate to the charity?
column22: Your donation will be directly deducted from your task payment.
column23: You can choose any amount from $0 to all your payment
column24: The payment of the task is 30 cents, I would donate 10c
column25: That is awesome!
column26: Thank you so much! What are you hoping your donation will help with?
column27: its not a lot but hopefully go towards someone else donation to help children in war zone areas
column28: I am so grateful for your donation.
column29: It means alot to this rganization.
column30: Of course, its a great organization to support

column11: There is  a lack of support for children in developing countries, especially in war zones.
column12: For instance, millions of Syrian children have grown up facing the daily threat of violence.

column14: Your donation can address such problems.
column15: Oh wow, shocking news.
column16: Do you know how many children have been helped due to this organization?

column19: Thats awesome!

column7: Yes pleas do
column8: They help children make sure they have access to health resources, education, and safe environments.
column9: Sounds like a good charity.
column10: What countries do they provide service to?
column11: mainly children in developing countries.
column12: Did you know over 1,000 children were killed in Syria in just the first 2 months of 2018.
column13: What kind of health benefits to they provide to the children?
column14: they provide them access to doctors and medicine that they wouldnt normally get.
column15: Donations are their main source of income.
column16: What is the standard monthly donation someone usually gives.
column17: A lot of people like to give 30/month so it's only a dollar a day.
column18: however any donation helps, even just 1 dollar.
column19: What percentage of my donation actually makes it to the children?
column20: 86% goes towards the services...
column21: the rest is used mainly for fundraising efforts
column22: Could you provide a breakdown of where that 14% goes?
column23: 9% fundraising and 5% goes towards keeping the charity running like salaries etc

column25: I'm not sure about religious organizations but several large companies partner with them.
column26: Would you consider making a donation?
column27: Could you pleas give examples of the large companies?
column28: Google, Disney, target and paypal
column29: What percentage of your total donations come from these large corporations.
column30: Most come from individuals like you.

column4: Great!

column6: Yes, so I think it is a good idea to donate to the childrens charity.
column7: Same here!
column8: I am volunteering for the charity called Save the Children.
column9: Are you familiar with them?
column10: No I am not.
column11: Can you tell me about it?
column12: They promote children's rights and help support kids in developing countries.
column13: It takes so little money to help feed a starving child.
column14: What can I do to help?
column15: I'm so glad you asked!
column16: One thing you could do is agree to contribute what you make just from this one task we are doing right now.

column10: When you see all the crazy things happening in the world today, famine, genocide, etc. it seems so important to help.
column11: We are so lucky to live in a country where almost everyone has at least the minimum needed for survival.
column12: So many poor kids around the world don't have food, clothing, shelter.
column13: I'm so glad these amazing charities help those kids.
column14: I appreciate the letters that I receive to see the impact that our donations make.
column15: Although it is not much money for us its makes a huge difference to the children from what I have seen.
column16: How long have you been donating?

column18: I started back in college, when an extra few dollars a month was a lot to give, and now that I've moved on in my career and life I'm thankful I'm able to give more.
column19: Plus, Save the Children is really high rated on Charity Watch.
column20: You know some charities spend 75 percent of donations back into gathering more money and administration etc.
column21: Save the Children is able to give away nearly everything they gather.

column23: That is good.
column24: I've heard good things about Save the Children.
column25: I think my brother sponsors a kid with them.
column26: I believe World Vision is rated highly as well.
column27: I'm glad that I can help others in need since I've been blessed a bit to help others.
column28: Absolutely.
column29: We are blessed to be a blessing, that's what I believe.
column30: You know what, you've encouraged me.
column31: I think I'm going to donate the money I earn today to Save the Children.

column33: It won't be much but every penny counts.

column35: Sure.

column45: Ok, sounds good.

column47: I'm so glad I got partnered with you.

column2: Hello! How are you doing today?
column3: I ' m doing avery well thank yout!
column4: How is your day going so far?
column5: I am doing well.
column6: My day has been busy visiting different places to speak about the charity I support.
column7: Have you heard of Save the Children?
column8: It sounds familiar to me, could you tell me more about it?
column9: Helping children in countries that are very war torn or in some form of conflict is what we help in.
column10: Everyday 16,000 children die before their 5th birthday, 1 out of 80 flee the country and risk everything, and 1 out of 6 kids aren't enrolled in a school or getting education that they need
column11: The charity sounds like it is doing some good work in an area that badly needs it.
column12: Children should be our top priority all across the world.
column13: How can someone get involved and help out with this charity?
column14: Oh there are quiet a few ways.
column15: For roughly a dollar a day you can sponsor a child, you can choose a gift to spend to a child through our catalog, you could start a fundraiser, or you can just simply donate.
column16: With that, keep in mind if you ever decide to make a monetary donation, 86% goes directly to the children, 9% fundraising, and 5% management and general.
column17: Just so you can have an idea that we use 9 out of 10 dollars directly on the children.
column18: I do believe I would like to donate some money to the Save the Children charity.
column19: Could I pledge $1/day to start with?
column20: absolutely thank you so much!!
column21: I like to donate money and time to charities that help children so I also want to thank you for educating me on this charity!
column22: Absolutely.
column23: I love getting the word out there on this charity.
column24: I strongly believe in it and its values on helping children.
column25: Children should be a priority in the world.
column26: They are our future.
column27: They are our future exactly.
column28: Any time I can help improve a situation for a child in need I hope to be able to do so.
column29: How long have you been supporting this charity?
column30: I have been supporting this charity for 15 years.

column47: Hou are welcome and thank you by bringning mu attention to such a well deserved charty!

column2: Hello! How are you doing today?
column3: I'm doing very well thank you!
column4: How is your day going so far?
column5: I am doing well.
column6: My day has been busy visiting different places to speak about the charity I support.
column7: Have you heard of Save the Children?
column8: It sounds familiar to me, could you tell me more about it?
column9: Helping children in countries that are very war torn or in some form of conflict is what we help in.
column10: Everyday 16,000 children die before their 5th birthday, 1 out of 80 flee the country and risk everything, and 1 out of 6 kids aren't enrolled in a school or getting education that they need
column11: The charity sounds like it is doing some good work in an area that badly needs it.
column12: Children should be our top priority all across the world.
column13: How can someone get involved and help out with this charity?
column14: Oh there are quiet a few ways.
column15: For roughly a dollar a day you can sponsor a child, you can choose a gift to spend to a child through our catalog, you could start a fundraiser, or you can just simply donate.
column16: With that, keep in mind if you ever decide to make a monetary donation, 86% goes directly to the children, 9% fundraising, and 5% management and general.
column17: Just so you can have an idea that we use 9 out of 10 dollars directly on the children.
column18: I do believe I would like to donate some money to the Save the Children charity.
column19: Could I pledge $1/day to start with?
column20: absolutely thank you so much!!
column21: I like to donate money and time to charities that help children so I also want to thank you for educating me on this charity!
column22: Absolutely.
column23: I love getting the word out there on this charity.
column24: I strongly believe in it and its values on helping children.
column25: Children should be a priority in the world.
column26: They are our future.
column27: They are our future exactly.
column28: Any time I can help improve a situation for a child in need I hope to be able to do so.
column29: How long have you been supporting this charity?
column30: I have been supporting this charity for 15 years.
column31: I also must clarify with you about your donation, if you so choose too.
column32: Your donation will be directly deducted from your task payment today.
column33: You can choose as little as $0 all the way up to all of your payment.
column34: That being said, would you still like to donate $1 to the Save the Children charity, starting to make a difference in a childs life?
column35: I would like to start making a difference today.
column36: I would want to still donate $1 to the Save the Children charity.
column37: Thank you!
column38: That makes my heart so happy.
column39: Did you know in the first two months of 2018 alone, over 1,000 children were killed or injured seriously by violence in Syria?
column40: Just know that your donation today, and hopefully the start of more to come, will help children like this.
column41: I hate hearing about children being subjected to violence.
column42: It hurts my heart.
column43: I do hope I can help and that my small donation does some good for a child.
column45: Well that sounds just great to me!
column46: Thank you once again for your donation and feel free to spread the word about the charity to others!
column47: You are welcome and thank you for bringing my attention to such a well deserved charity!

column2: Good Morning, Have you heard at the charity Save the CHildren ?
column3: Yes I haver.
column4: It is a wonderful charity.
column5: Save the Children is an international non-governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries.
column6: That is amazing.
column7: Tell me more.
column8: When you figure the time we spend on buying unnecessary things like candy, car washes, or dining out, we can support these children in developing countries !
column9: I would like to help.
column10: What would you consider an acceptable contribution?
column11: I would like to think of supporting a child by $1 a day or $30 a month.
column12: $1 a day can be used in meaningful ways to help these children
column13: I think I can definitely afford $1 a day.
column14: Your $1 a day will help their essential needs like health, education safety and clothing.
column15: Just the essentials can make a child lead a more fulfilled and loving life
column16: Where do I sign up?
column17: Being able to support a child is a moral thing to do.
column18: I believe u would make a tangible impact on these children.
column19: You can sign up at :  URL
column20: However, before you do, I'd like to tell you a bit more
column21: Yes, I would like to hear more.
column22: I love helping where I can.
column23: Those less fortunate deserve better.
column24: These children die from hunger daily.
column25: Your donation is making an impact on the children and their families
column26: Do you donate to this cause as well?
column27: If so, how much do you give?
column28: I do  !
column29: I give $30 a month Save the children is international and helps children in all nations
column30: I think you are a wonderful person.
column31: Thank you so much for telling me about this.
column32: Your donation is part of the solution and you realize how it is a morally responsibility obligation .
column33: I admire that !
column34: I will give a dollar a day, I'm sure I won't even notice the money missing and I'll know that I am helping out.
column35: Thank you for the compliment and your generous donation !
column36: Thank you for the lovely chat and educational information.
column37: You've been great.
